text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- (Deputy prime minister) Cascos puts stop to criticism to (Basque Nationalist Party) PNV at the heart of the (governing) Popular Party
- Government wants to make most of calendar fixed for adapting to euro
- Blair pressures Unionists in Northern Ireland to negotiate peace
- New York police rescue 62 deaf Mexican salves
EL MUNDO
- Survey: 92 percent of Spaniards want prisoners to serve full sentences
- (Marxist guerilla group) GRAPO head Sanchez Casas warns on leaving prison that the group will continue fight
- PP has 3.9 point lead over (socialist party) PSOE
DIARIO 16
- (Basque separatists) ETA try to take revenge on democrats
ABC
- At least 130 ETA members hide from Spanish justice in Mexico
CINCO DIAS
- Tabacco firms' SOS: Health department proposes banning all tobacco advertising
- Has the stock market adjustment arrived?
- New electricity rate to pay for coal
EXPANSION
- Government rejects demands of (Catalan nationalist allies) CiU in new coastal law
- Treasury strengthens 18-month T-bills to meet Maastricht debt test
- Telefonica has to reform lines before February 1998
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Car makers earn just 1.28 percent of their income
- FCC -Dragados negotiate UK contract
- Spending in autonomous regions up 11.4 percent
--Madrid newsroom + 34 1 585 8340
